Message:
I had fallen asleep
in the school hallway,
exhausted from my
embarassing little meltdown.

Slowly, I woke up,
still cradled in my sister’s arms.

While I was fumbling
over my words, the smallest,
ever so tiniest hint of a smile
tugged at A.A.’s lips.

She took me by the hand and
led us back through the city,
now bathed in an orange glow.

I held her small, delicate,
yet warm hand—so fragile that
I hesitated to squeeze it back.

Then slowly, as if summoning
my own resolve,
I tightened my grip.

Mother did say that
the Qlipha Project bestowed A.A.
with an angel’s powers,
which granted her life.

And now, her power as a witch
was keeping her alive.

A witch’s power
comes from the heart.

I still don’t really understand
what that means, but I’ll get
to the bottom of it one day.

Because it’s the only way
I can hope to save my dear sister.
